questions.question_text: Which of the following tools scans the network systems for well-known and often exploited vulnerabilities?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Nessus is for analizing vulns

Selected Answer: A
SATAN (Security Administrator Tool for Analyzing Networks) is an older network scanning tool that was used for identifying potential vulnerabilities in networked systems. However, it is not commonly used today as it was last updated in 1995 and is no longer actively maintained. Nessus, on the other hand, is a more modern and actively maintained tool that is widely used for vulnerability scanning.

questions.question_text: Which of the following tools examines a system for a number of known weaknesses and alerts the administrator?
Which of the following is the full form of SAINT?

discussion.content:
correct is B

SAINT (Security Administrator's Integrated Network Tool) is computer software used for scanning computer networks for security vulnerabilities, and exploiting found vulnerabilities.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SAINT_(software)#:~:text=SAINT%20(Security%20Administrator's%20Integrated%20Network,vulnerabilities%2C%20and%20exploiting%20found%20vulnerabilities.

Selected Answer: B
Correct answer is B

Correct is B

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a type of VPN that involves a single VPN gateway?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A remote-access VPN allows individual users to establish secure connections with a corporate network from remote locations using a single VPN gateway. This gateway acts as the sole access point for all remote users to connect to the organization's internal network resources

Selected Answer: A
A remote-access VPN allows individual users to establish secure connections with a corporate network from remote locations using a single VPN gateway. This gateway acts as the sole access point for all remote users to connect to the organization's internal network resources.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a free security-auditing tool for Linux?

discussion.content:
hping3 is a free packet generator and analyzer for the TCP/IP protocol. Hping is one of the de-facto tools for security auditing and testing of firewalls and networks, and was used to exploit the Idle Scan scanning technique now implemented in the Nmap port scanner.

https://wiki.networksecuritytoolkit.org/index.php/HowTo_Perform_A_Security_Audit_With_hping3_(DoS)
